runs.comm: back of a length outside off and moving away, Shahzaib plays watchfully and picks a single behind square on the off side.
slips down the leg to Farhat the left hander. A touch of the pad on the way denies the wide
no such luck this time, Farhat made sure he let it go safely to the keeper. Morkel got this closer to the batsman, but not close enough.
this time he's really sprayed it. A good foot and a half down the leg. Easy call for wide
crisply done. Albie finally lands one on the money, but it is invitingly over-pitched on middle stump and he flicks it elegantly over square leg
this is a poor start from Albie and Farhat is not letting him get away with it. Another gently half volley on the pads and Farhat gets inside the line and whips it in front of square leg
finally lands one on middle and leg, Farhat punches it nicely on the up but can't beat a sliding mid off
Well well, Albie has left his radar device back in South Africa. Wide down the leg
it does look like Albie believes Farhat is a right hander, despite all the evidence to the contrary. Another one goes down the leg.
over-pitched on middle and leg again, but this time there is protection at deep midwicket to prevent Farhat from flicking happily for four more. Just a single this time.
better start from this end, hits the deck back of a length and pushes Farhat into the backfoot defence
a hint of room this time just outside off and enough for Farhat to steer to the right of point for a single
angles across the right hander at 133 kph, and Shahzaib reaches out to play it towards point. Tall batsman, is Shahzaib. A half stride helps him cover a couple of feet
that's it, Shahzaib has seen enough and looks to thump one into Dubai. Misses making contact though as it whistles past outside off stump
hmm, a hint of inward movement from Tsotsobe, Shahzaib presses forward and ends up looking quite prone in front of the stumps. Thankfully got some inside edge out to square leg for a single

and gone. Farhat did not have to do this, he walked down the track, looking to dominate Tsotsobe early. It was floated well outside off, beating Farhat's pre-meditated intention to go over the leg side. Ended up going through with the shot anyway. Mistake. It took the toe end of the bat and landed in first slip's lap.

big appeal, rightly turned down. Shahzaib again pushes his front foot out, it seems like a trigger movement that will have him in trouble against inward movement. Morne got it to jag back in and it hit him on the pads. But it was too high
good ball, except for the over-stepping. Shahzai ended up poking uncertainly as it shaped away from a length

another no-ball. Albie specialises in wides, while Morne takes care of no-balls. Hmm. Shahzaib looks to launch the free-hit over wide long on, but it comes on faster and he ends up playing the shot too early. Single taken as the catch balloons to the outfield inconsequentially
lovely shot from Hafeez, he makes room by backing away from the stumps as Morne over-pitched on and outside off stump. Hafeez went down on his knees and drilled it square. Smoothly played.
hits the deck back of a length and forces Hafeez on to the backfoot. Defended to the offside
a hint of room outside off and Hafeez looks to slam it on the up. Straight to cover though. This pitch looks good.

another top shot from Hafeez! This was quick from Morne, pushing Hafeez back, but there was around half a foot of room outside off. Enough for Hafeez to go back in the crease, ride the bounce and coax it through point.
ends up with a fish outside off as Morne gets it to move away from outside off stump.
Shahzaib does that again, looking to fetch a ball from middle and off without quite getting to the pitch as it deviates in from a length. Inside edge dribbles away square on the leg side for one
on the stumps from Tsotsobe, who has easily looked the best of the three bowlers so far. Hafeez spots the hint of inswing, covers the deviation and punches to mid on for a quick single

Shahzaib gets a short one, and early indications that this is what he likes facing. Pushes forward as is his wont, but rocks back in time to slam the pull shot to deep square leg for one. It went in a trice.
slow off cutter at 127 kph, Hafeez spotted the change in pace and ran it down square on the off side for one
another slower ball, 120 kph this time and Shahzaib picks a single behind square on the off side
Hafeez drives on the up through the covers, literally, since the fielder there dives over the ball. Theron runs across from mid off to keep it down to two. Not very well timed this time.
another almighty swing and a miss from Shahzaib. Planted the front foot forward a good second in advance and looked to detonate it over long off. Missed the line completely though.
slower ball, swing and a miss again. Guess what, Morne has over-stepped again as well.

short ball, hurries Shahzaib into a rather ungainly pull. He was setting himself for the front foot hit, but the bounce forced him into a pull. Top edge goes straight over the keeper's head for three.
slow off cutter from Morne, cleverly done and completely befuddles Hafeez, who played an attempted flick without getting his feet into position, approximately one second before the ball came
normal pace this time, coming into Hafeez who punches crisply to mid on
a touch of room outside off and Hafeez tries to steer it through point, but can't get it past the fielder
driven in pleasing fashion out to mid off. Too well-timed to steal a single

Shahzaib is gone. It is the kind of dismissal you would expect from someone who plonks the front foot across without intent to reach the length, and drives almost always on the up. It was on a length from Tsotsobe again, angling across Shahzaib, who did that half-stride across and looked to go over the off side. He ended up scooping it straight over Duminy at point, who ran back around 20 yards and took a nice tumbling catch.
fullish on the stumps and Hafeez drives it to mid on

close call - direct hit might have got him. Hafeez got some pad on it as it came in from back of a length on the stumps. It dribbled out to the off side and Duminy swooped across quickly as the batsmen hesitated. He shied, but missed.
full and well outside off, Akmal looks for an expensive off drive, but can't quite time it
lets one go outside off as it angles across from well outside off
Umar plays the shot of the evening. Marginally over-pitched by Tsotsobe outside the off stump, Akmal rises with the bounce and slams it with the full face through the covers
slowish delivery, back of a length outside off and it is run off the face square on the off side for one

Umar Akmal is jumping around in his crease, prances out to off stump and then looks to get well forward even before Theron is in delivery stride. Ends up playing and missing to a back of length ball outside off
and again, Akmal jumps across and fishes without looking like making contact..
back of a length outside off, Umar gets behind the line this time and defends down the track

well-fielded at the third man fence by Bosman. Akmal gets beside the line this time and steers it well, it looked like it may have run across, but Bosman ran across quickly and put in the dive to stop it
there is mackerel in the Red Sea, and Umar Akmal wants it. Only that can explain this compulsive fishing outside off
tossed up on off, Hafeez reaches out and plays it back to the bowler.

Hafeez is gone, and very unfortunate too. He makes room on the off side by backing away before Botha delivered and made good contact, perhaps too good contact, as his carve over the off side ended in deep point's hands as he ran across to his right.
AB de Villiers has put it down. Lovely stuff from Botha, tosses it up outside off and Umar reaches out, defeated by the loop and gets a thick outside edge. AB can't hold on
gets well behind that one and defends to the off side
Umar Akmal drives out to the covers and that brings Afridi on strike

Strike Rate of 600. Thank you very much. Afridi trots out, gets to the pitch and launches Botha over the long-on boundary that is pulled well in. Would not have mattered anyway. Afridi means business. As usual.
Akmal does the smart thing. Another single, this time runs it from outside off behind point, to give Afridi strike
back of a length outside off, without much pace. Afridi waits for it and fiercely uncocks those wrists at the last moment to pick a couple to deep point
Bang. Short ball from Theron, may have been a slower ball, but Afridi picked it early and pulled it wide of mid on. A moment later the ball thudded into the wide long on boundary boards.
another slow off cutter, Afridi again spots it and works it off the back foot to midwicket for one
back of a length outside off and coming in as Akmal reaches out and plays back to the bowler
111 kph outside off, and Akmal waits an eternity before managing to make contact with the glide and pick a single to deep third man
Botha drops it short and Akmal cuts it into the covers for one

that's big, that's huge, that's as high as the Burj Dubai! Afridi chips out again and gets to the pitch. Once that happens, the rest is of only academic interest. It booms off the middle off the bat, takes off into the Abu Dhabi night and lands well behind long on
mid-hit, but that does not matter. Afridi looked to cross bat this without getting to the pitch, ended up getting a top edge but it still happily carried over Bosman at long on. Well.

finally, Afridi mistimes one well enough for it to land inside the field of play. Another cross batted heave, this time it goes off the bottom half of the bat and comes down around 10 feet inside the ropes at long on. Bosman pouches it and Abu Dhabi goes slient.
tossed up on off, reaches out and works it to the leg side for one.
tossed up on the pads and Misbah clips it to midwicket to get going on his comeback to the side
back of a length outside off, comes in as Misbah defends
over-pitched on the pads and Misbah plays it out to long on for one
Albie will prefer this - two right handers batting - back of a length outside off and defended
outside off this time and he looks to run it off the face but can't get it past point
over-pitched on the pads and Umar nearly falls over as he looks to squeeze it to the leg side. Ends up getting a single to mid on
gentle and wide outside off, Misbah reaches out and looks to square drive but can't get it past squarish third man
flighted on middle and leg, Misbah looks to work it with the spin, but can't beat short fine leg.
the floater, befuddles Misbah completely as he looks to cover the non-existent spin. Whizzes past the outside edge
this one turns in and he works it with the spin to the leg side
Botha is troubling Misbah here, another floater, and Misbah closes the face expecting spin, and gets a leading edge into the covers. Single taken though
Umar skips out, reaches the pitch and drives it with the spin to long off. Some good running helps them pick two, despite Tsotsobe's sterling effort on the boundary

whoa, cat and mouse stuff. Misbah moves away to the leg side, Morkel sees him and drops a slow bouncer. Misbah waits for it and makes contact with a gentle forehand, but can't place it through the off side
good bowling, nice variation with lengths there. Misbah is forced back into a hurried defensive shot down the track
fuller on off stump and this time Misbah manages to drive down the ground for one

well, there are ways of getting out, and then there is this. Umar Akmal has gone here, spotting a slow bouncer from Albie early and swatting it ferociously. A foot on either side of Botha at midwicket inside the circle would have given him four, but he found the man with surgical precision.
pitched up at 125 kph, Razzaq'a feet movement was so slow as he shaped to drive it to mid off. "Played away beautifully for nothing," says Ramiz Raja on air.
off cutter at 126 kph, Razzaq got a thick inside edge as he looked to drive. Single to long on
slides down the leg for a wide
pulls it back a touch outside off and Razzaq taps into the covers for one
Misbah can't get it away, worked with the spin to midwicket
shorter this time, slides down the pads and Misbah picks a single behind square on the leg side
Razzaq moves into an airy drive to a floater extremely late. Somehow gets it out to deep point for a couple

and gone. Razzaq'a languid movements do him in as Botha slips in another floater and Razzaq gropes belatedly inside the line, after getting half forward very late. Off stump is uprooted and Pakistan are disintegrating.
tossed up outside off and Haider eases into a check drive square on the off side.
big appeal for caught behind turned down by umpire Rauf. That was sliding down the leg and there was a woody noise as it passed the batsman. Did he get a nick?
on the money this time, Haider can't do much with it and works it back to the bowler.

easy as they come. Haider's eyes lit up the moment he saw that there was some width. He got half forward into the square drive, but once again, he neither went decisively over the top, nor took the effort to keep it along the ground. Head high catch for a jumping Duminy at point. Gone.
Good stuff from Morne, gets disconcerting bounce from just back of a length and a nagging line, which forces Gul into a defensive fend.

Gul had no clue what to do with that bouncer. Should he go for an out of position pull? Should he take it on the body? Should he flick and hope he middles it? He went for option three, but ended getting a top edge that popped up and landed a second later, next to him. Could have gone anywhere
Clueless is Gul. Another short ball, whizzes a foot away from his body outside off as he makes up his mind on how to play it. By the time he had, the ball was in AB de Villiers' gloves
back of a length outside off and worked off the face of the bat through point for one
extra pace from Morne, lack of pace from Tsotsobe - both are tormenting Gul equally. Pushes out uncertainly and gets as inside edge as it comes on slowly. Dribbles out to mid on

well, that was an agonising stay for Gul and the good part for him is that it has come to an end. Back of a length and angling across him, he chose the pull - can't blame him, he had tried several other shots without success in that short stay - but sadly, he was very late on it. Top edge balloons up and lands in Smith's bucket hands on the square leg boundary
textbook punch from Misbah into the covers, all for a single
fuller outside off and Ajmal can't quite time the drive into the off side
back of a length outside off and Ajmal manages to late cut it to deep third man for one
Morne hits the deck again and pushes Ajmal back. But he does well to dab it into the off side for a single
angles into Misbah from outside off, and back of a length. It is the kind of approach that ensures the batsman cannot get a boundary without taking a risk. Misbah takes none.
short ball, gets really big on Misbah who gets into all kinds of problems as he looks to swat-pull and keep it down. It does not go anywhere.
another short ball, another unconvincing swat pull to mid on. Single taken this time
slower ball at 122 kph, so slow that Ajmal had played his pull shot and was looking at fine leg when the ball came and hit his shoulder
makes reasonable contact this time with the pull and gets it over the infield for a single to the leg side
length ball outside off and Ajmal punches uppishly almost back into the bowler's hands. Theron doesn't reach soon enough and it is a single to long off
Misbah is still not looking for boundaries. Gets a single with a non-violent flick to midwicket

Ajmal is run out. It is one of those days when NOTHING is going Pakistan's way. Length ball on off stump. Ajmal times the off drive rather well, but Theron on his follow through gets his hand on it and parries it into the covers. Ajmal is well out of the crease looking for a single when the throw from Miller in the covers comes in and breaks the stumps at the striker's end. Ajmal is around a foot short.
and finallt some respite. Tsotsobe misfields at cover as Shoaib drives the full toss, and ends up conceding three
Pakistan have raised their slowest 100 in T20s, despite Afridi's 7-ball blitz for 25. Misbah takes another single into the leg side.
full toss on the pads and Shoaib defends. It was imperative that he survived that ball to give Misbah a shot at some late fireworks
over-pitched outside off, Misbah looks to go down on a knee and cart it over the leg side, but he can't time it at all. He refuses the single to long on
goes for the pull this time, but can't place it past midwicket. Another possible single denied.

Well, Albie has completely decieved Misbah with his lines there. Misbah was prancing inside the crease, jumping across to off stump but Albit kept it even wider outside off and Misbah had to let it go
full-toss on off stump and finally some respite. Misbah dumps it over Morkel's head for a straight four. First bounday since the 10th over.
and again, this is poor from Albie, who delivers another full toss. Misbah does well to go down on a knee and get under it. Another loft over Morkel's head and four more.
well done by Misbah, who calmly nurdles a ball on the pads for a single to square leg. He retains strike for the final over
attempted yorker, ends up as a half volley but the angle is perfect as it comes into Misbah and denies him a chance to drill off the back foot through the covers. He refuses the single
short ball, another mis-timed pull from Misbah and another single refused.
125 kph and Misbah is still so late on the pull that Sriram Veera likens it to Alberto Berasategui's forehand. Straight to midwicket. No run.
Moral of the story - don't give Misbah full tosses. Theron delivers this knee high on leg stump and Misbah gets everything behind it as he blasts it over deep square leg for six.

Akhtar is run out and Pakistan are all out. Misbah can't get much power on the off drive as he looks to play off the back foot. He tried to take two to retain strike. Miller, running in from long off, collected from inside the circle and threw down the stumps for the second time in the day. Shoaib was never going to make it at the bowler's end.
